arts.ttl: Bid submitted as Tottenham push to finalise signing of attacker with 37 goals & 12 assists
arts.sum: Tottenham have reportedly set their sights on Barcelona forward Ansu Fati in a bid to bolster their injury-hit squad as the January transfer window nears its conclusion. According to a report from Fichajes, Spurs have submitted a loan offer for the 22-year-old Spanish international, which includes an option for a permanent transfer. arts.ttl: Friday briefing: Fernandes gives Man Utd win and Son brace sees Tottenham home
arts.sum: Manchester United left it late to snatch victory over Rangers in Europe, while a host of Premier League managers will face the media on Friday

arts.ttl: Spurs' Solanke out six weeks with knee injury
arts.sum: Tottenham striker Dominic Solanke is likely to be out for around six weeks because of a knee injury, Spurs manager Ange Postecoglou said Thursday.

arts.ttl: Man City star Rodri is joined by partner Laura Iglesias at Indiana Pacers' clash with San Antonio Spurs at NBA Paris Games as he continues ACL recovery
arts.sum: A day after his side lost 4-2 against Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League, leaving them staring a league phase knockout in the face, the Ballon d'Or-winner was seen courtside.

arts.ttl: Brighton hold talks over move for Evan Ferguson - as Premier League rivals including Tottenham and Bournemouth keep tabs on up-and-coming striker
arts.sum: SIMON JONES: The 20-year old has returned to full training after recovering from an ankle injury and could become one of the most coveted players of the January window

arts.ttl: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend
arts.sum: Harvey Elliott deserves a Liverpool start, Chelsea should go for the jugular at City and Mikey Moore would help Spurs In a surprise to pre-season predictors, this match is as important as a fixture in January can be in the battle for Champions League football. Nottingham Forest head into the weekend level with second-placed Arsenal, while Bournemouth are three points behind fourth-placed Chelsea and seven back from Forest. The scrutiny on both teams is growing but they keep answering the questions thrown at them. Despite having no out-and-out striker last weekend, Bournemouth put four past Newcastle, giving Nuno Espírito Santo a warning. Justin Kluivert scored a hat-trick, his second of the season, at St James’ Park as Andoni Iraola’s flexible front four excelled. Nikola Milenkovic and Murillo might feel more confident against a natural No 9 but Forest’s centre-back pairing will relish the challenge. Will Unwin Bournemouth v Nottingham Forest, Saturday 3pm (all times GMT) Brighton v Everton, Saturday 3pm Liverpool v Ipswich, Saturday 3pm Southampton v Newcastle, Saturday 3pm Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Tottenham injury news: Ange Postecoglou reveals prognosis on Dominic Solanke knee injury
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou confirms that striker Dominic Solanke will miss the next six weeks of action, after twisting his knee in training.

arts.ttl: Midfielder puts pen to paper as Tottenham officially announce deal
arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur have taken another step in solidifying their long-term future by signing 17-year-old forward George Feeney to his first professional contract. The club announced the deal on their official website, expressing delight at securing the services of the promising youngster. arts.ttl: Tottenham Europa League permutations explained after Hoffenheim win
arts.sum: To qualify with a draw, Spurs would need four of Anderlecht, FCSB, Galatasaray, Bodo/Glimt, Viktoria Plzen and Olympiacos to drop points. A draw would leave Postecoglou’s side on 15 points, meaning that they can be overtaken by Galatasaray, Bodo/Glimt, Viktoria Plzn and Olympiacos should they all win.

You can’t underestimate European football away from home, especially the first game, with a pretty relatively inexperienced team in front of him and I thought he handled it really well and we’ll need him again next week." We knew this game would be a bit of a target for him and Fraser had an illness that knocked him back a bit, but I just felt on the back of his performance in the league game that Brandon deserved a crack at it and I thought he did well tonight.
